snippet: Amid complaints from residents of Fire Island, the company said it would start laying fiber optic cable to restore service in areas ravaged by Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Verizon, amid complaints from Fire Island residents, backs away from its plan to use wireless devices to replace traditional phone service in areas where copper wires were ruined by Hurricane Sandy; company says it will instead start laying fiber-optic cable to restore home phone service and Internet access.
lead_paragraph: Amid complaints from residents of Fire Island, the company said it would start laying fiber optic cable to restore service in areas ravaged by Hurricane Sandy.

headline.main: Verizon Backing Off Plans for Wireless Home Phones
headline.print_headline: Verizon Backing Off Plans For Wireless Home Phones
